name: WOKUNI
address: 327 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

reviews.text: I really love this spot. Any dietary restrictions can be accommodated, the place is beautiful, staff is friendly, bar is really lovely. Really good lunch spot that will surprise and delight because so many people don't know the place. So nice for dinner too! The vibe changes and it gets sexy and intimate.  Great for a date or client meeting. Good service.

Quite crowded for a weekday lunch. Ambience appears upscale and chic.

The daily specials were all sold out by 12.30pm. Had the bara chirashi don lunch set which came with miso soup and salad. Added on ikura.

Fish was amazingly fresh and worked well with the avocado and Japanese egg cubes. Iâ€™m reminiscing of my lunch there. Was one of my best Japanese meals in the city and I need to return soon.

Portion was large enough I didnâ€™t feel hungry leaving the restaurant. Pretty good value.

Waitstaff was okay, friendly enough.
Great staff, delicious, super fresh and inventive sushi , in a cool environment
Great fun at the the tuna auction!

Tuna experience is a 10/10! They are fantastic hosts, the whole production is very entertaining and impressive. We bid on the tuna cheek and eye and got both - one tip is that people up their bids last minute so be wary. They honored our second highest bid even when someone tried to outbid us once the auction had closed, was very kind of them. I also recommend requesting to sit at the bar for the auction as you receive a lot of attention from both the host cutting up the tuna as well as waiters for the service. The waiters, staff and hosts were all top notch - very personable and kind. I brought my boyfriend for his birthday and he had the best time. This is a fabulous date or gift experience.
The tuna bid was a lot of fun and I'm so happy to have won the eye ball. Other than the $5 bowl of rice that was kinda soggy, this place is really amazing!

Go early for the Wokuni Don. The fish is incredibly fresh and tasty. For the price and quality itâ€™s a must have at lunch. Go early as there are only limited quantities. Portions are good, service is quick and friendly.

Very very delicious bara chirashi. It came with so much rice and fish. My daughter and I shared one and we were both stuffed. Itâ€™s best to come here really hungry because the portion is big. The kids sushi boat was so fun also. At $15, it came with a mini salmon chirashi, karage, tomago, fruit, sausage and a hidden treat in the boat! My husband ordered the sashimi bowl, which had a maximum limit of 5 servings per day. He loved the sashimi bowl so much and this was the best sushi he had in the U.S. so far! So thankful to my sister in law treating us to this amazing meal.

The restaurant was almost fully packed when we arrived. We came just a little after the opening time also. Best to come extra early or make a reservation. The decor was modern yet luxurious and the bathrooms were clean and nicely scented like a Japanese wood (I forget the name).

We saw the main chef from our table. The sushi chefs were super busy for sure!

We canâ€™t wait to visit NYC and eat here again!
The food is very authentic and I love it! This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the city!

Great place. I truly enjoyed the quality and presentation of food. Everything was fresh, tasty and beautiful.
The atmosphere is so pleasant. The entire place brings you Asian vibes. Additionally, on a Saturday for lunch, I did not need reservations for 3 ( last minutes reservations can be challenging but this place was great). We all were satisfied with the entire experience. We probably spent more than 2 hours there and never felt they were rushing us. The price was also a positive point of our visit. I highly recommend this place.

On a totally side note, the charge of my friend's cellphone was super low and as a surprise, the server told us about they having a charging station. I give a 10/10 for the place, service and food!
Affordable and fantastic dishes. Ivan is a G

Iâ€™m not an Asian food connoisseur and donâ€™t usually go to Asian restaurants, but this place is special. A true gem. The sushi is exceptional and so were the noodles. Ambience and service were great too. I ended up going 2 days in a row ğŸ¤ŒğŸ»ğŸ˜Š
Encontramos este restaurante por casualidad. Fue una experiencia muy buena, recomendamos 100%!
ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»
The sushi was fresh and the miso was delicious. Staff were attentive and checked in often. Would stop by here again!
Great place for shushi and sashimi

The food was mid. we paid with two cards, splitting half and half, and got two receipts. We tipped half of the suggestion amount each on the receipt, which totals up to be whatâ€™s on suggestion on receipt, as the tip suggestion was based on the total cost.
The manager came back with our two receipts and throw those on table, demanding that itâ€™s less than 10% and we should tip more.
The manager misunderstood the receipt, and his attitude was very humiliating and very rude.
He should not work in the service industry when he canâ€™t control his attitude.
Omakase is a great deal. It also includes non-sushi items and dessert, which was appealing.

Lunch great! Love chirashi. Shame some runs out fast.

-----
Used to come more often to Eastside... when working for Japanese firm... Sushi Yasuda, etc...

One of the best.. especially after Sushiden's gone. Like Sushi Ann, Hatsuhana, Hakubai as well as Sushi of Gari's too. But, not as of a fan for Sugarfish.

Here.. tall ceiling, good decor of woods, Japanese tiles, ropes... ambiance with bar full of Japanese sake and beer welcoming.

Food excellent. Both mix of generous portion as well as high quality pieces. $150 omakase not the only option... thus, wide spectrum from Sushi enthusiasts as well as casual drinking, tapas-like scene.

Love dashi mini pot. Can't resist refill. Always end up ordering more... but, eat all...

Arigato

Great restraunt! Definitely the best and most authentic japanese restraunt I have ever been to. Our server was extremely kind and every time we got one of our courses, he would tell us exactly what we are eating. Thefood was excellent and the fish was very fresh. Would recommend.
Great go-to-place for fresh sushi and izakaya. Fish market is great; picked up fresh uni, ikura, and scallops. Happy hour raw oysters! For lunch try the Wokuni Don see pix
Cool place for dinner. Prices are a bit on a higher end, but still affordable. The food was amazing. Definitely worth a visit.

Came here after a long day of work because I wanted to treat myself and WOW. I was not disappointed. I am healed.

Ordered the salmon hitsumabushi (salmon sashimi with salmon flakes and fried salmon skin). The very patient, exacting server explained how to eat it: plain, then with toppings and finally with dashi broth. Extremely simple and satisfying. I can't wait to come back!
Get uni maki and odoro delivered. They tasted ğŸ‘.â€¦
Good food and reasonable price!
Super fast service with big portions. Loved the bara chirashi bowl
Absolutely fantastic all the way around!!

Disappointing Sushi at Wokuni â€“ Proceed with Caution

I went to Wokuni for dinner and started on a high note with the oystersâ€”they were fresh, well-presented, and hit the spot. But the sashimi platter quickly turned things sour.

The platter arrived with five types of fish (15 pieces total). First up was the salmon, which smelled faintly fishyâ€”definitely not sushi-grade fare. It felt like something rolled out of Costcoâ€™s fresh case. The fluke that followed was similarly lackluster, lacking the clean, fresh quality sashimi should have.

The sea bass was a slight improvement, and the yellowtail was acceptable, though still not outstanding. But the real disappointment came with the tuna. I found a visible blood vein running through the fleshâ€”unappetizing and easily avoidable with proper trimming.

I flagged it and asked the server what was going on. He took it to the chef, who came back and told me, â€œThis is how Japanese eat sashimi.â€ That apologyâ€”or lack thereofâ€”was laughable and insulting. Any competent sushi chef knows the bloodline is removed because itâ€™s strong-tasting, off-putting, and hardly appetizing. If the chef canâ€™t be bothered to properly clean their fish, what else are they cutting corners on?

Bottom line: Inspect your sashimi before you eat it. My experience was disgusting and incredibly disappointing. This level of carelessness isnâ€™t what I expect for sushi. I wonâ€™t be returning, and I canâ€™t recommend Wokuni to anyone who cares about quality or value.
Love this place!!! Food, ambiance, service all is top top top!!!
I honestly believe that I am Wokuniâ€™s most regular customer. I find it unquestionably, the best mix of quality, service and ambiance for Japanese food in NYC.
The 5 kinds sashimi bowl has a good selection of fresh fish. The hamachi and tuna were very goodğŸ‘Œ
They are known for chirashi for lunch special. Good portion size lunch special. We got chirashi and sushi platter. For the price paid, chirashi was a better deal.
Awesome omakase

I visited this place with a couple of colleagues, and as someone who had never tried Japanese cuisine before, I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect. I canâ€™t recall exactly what we ordered since my colleagues did most of the choosing, but everything we had was genuinely impressive.

We tried a wide range of dishes, including different types of sushi, eel, salmon, and squid. I was especially surprised by the raw salmon. I honestly thought Iâ€™d struggle with it, but it turned out to be smooth, fresh, and unexpectedly delicious.

We also had two types of sake, both of which complemented the meal nicely. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the seating felt comfortable and well thought out. It made for a very relaxed dining experience.

The bill came to just over $270 for three people. It was a little on the expensive side for me personally, but considering the variety and quality of the food, Iâ€™d say it was still worth it.

For someone new to Japanese cuisine, this was a great first experience. Iâ€™d definitely recommend it to others who are curious to try something different.

Really enjoyed this lunch set. The sashimi was fresh and well-cut, and even the sushi rice stood outâ€”warm, well-seasoned, and perfectly cooked.

Service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Everything felt thoughtful and well-prepared. Would definitely come back.

I stumbled upon this restaurant today in NYC. My love for unagi don remains after all these years...over 20 since I was in the largest eel restaurant in the world in Tokyo. This eel was just as good! And my waiter was so personable. Ivan was amazing! Great service. Happy.
Chu-toro sashimi is my favorite. Also get to watch their hard working chefs in action which is a plus.

The atmosphere is gorgeous, food is very good. They manage food efficiently and hardly waste any food, which is probably why they are able to keep the prices reasonable when other places with similar interior, food quality and service tend to charge more.
Excellent quality fish and very nice stuff. I would highly recommend.
A great place in NY for really good Japanese food. The fish is incredibly fresh and the rice for the sushi is very good. Perfect temperature and texture. Great place.
Best omakase they have. We loved it

Excellent! Amazing execution of a menu that scales from affordable to Manhattan-night-out. My wife and I were perfectly happy making a meal of some tapas-sized dishes and the (truly excellent) duck entree, along with some Happy Hour drinks; we left, very happy, very well fed, and with our wallets intact. But if youâ€™d like to take that up a notch, this restaurant will be happily to take you to some impressive heights.

Our first visit here, we definitely will be back. Being unfamiliar with Japanese food and wanting more than "just" sush,i we asked our server Smith for some advice.  Smith was so helpful in recommending & explaining dishes and checking our preferences and said he would have the dishes adjusted accordingly.  The dishes he recommended were fantastic , and the service was friendly and efficient,  at no time did we feel rushed even though the restaurant was full. We definitely recommend Wokuni. It's not the cheapest place to eat but not bad for the quality and experience.  Thank you Smith.

This Japanese restaurant consistently delivers an outstanding dining experience with impeccable service and top-quality cuisine. As a regular customer, I am always impressed by their commitment to excellence, from their fresh sushi sourced directly from their fish farm in Japan to the perfectly grilled hamachi collar. The agedashi tofu is a comforting delight with its crispy exterior and silky interior, while the matcha and mochi ice cream is the perfect sweet finish. Our go-to sake, Dassai Nama, pairs beautifully with every dish.  A unique recent addition to their sushi counter is a silent fish auction screen above their sushi bar counter was a nice touch.  Their happy hour drink specials and Arigato set (fried chicken or oyster with Edamame) are a great deal and delicious ğŸ˜‹

This restaurant is a true culinary delight! From fresh sashimi and sushi to grilled fish and seafood dishes, every bite is a burst of flavor and freshness. The quality of the seafood is outstanding, with each dish showcasing the natural flavors of the ocean.  The service is impeccable with attentive staff who are knowledgeable and accommodating. They ensure a pleasant dining experience with prompt service and personalized recommendations. Overall, this restaurant is a must-visit for seafood lovers seeking a top-notch dining experience.

We were recommended this restaurant by a couple girls that we met after the Rangers game, and it couldnâ€™t have been a better recommendation! The atmosphere was gorgeous. The staff was friendly and the food was phenomenal!!! 10/10 recommend & will be back again next time in NYC!!!

Couldn't be happier we chose this place out of all nearby sushi places. Attentive courteous knowledgeable servers? Check! Fresh food and prompt service? Check! Great warm atmosphere and design? Check!
Nice sake collection plus they have some seating at a chef's station where you can watch food being plated.
Atmosphere was mostly afterwork crowd and not overly loud.
The fatty tuna was amazing. Not so crazy overall for Japanese desserts but that's my personal preference.

Amazing food!! Very fresh and delicious. Great amount of food and they are of the highest quality! Next time I will come earlier and get their Wokuni Don (only 8 servings per day). It looks sooooo good!

The food was delicious, especially the fresh fish. However, we were disappointed by the attitude of our server. Their demeanor was off-putting, and we were taken aback when they mentioned that the minimum tip amount is 18%. Upon reviewing the bill, we noticed that the server pointed out that 18% tip is shown, but it was actually labeled as a suggested amount, not mandatory. While we enjoyed the meal, the service aspect left something to be desired."

Wokuni was a great spot for dinner with friends. We had a really cute booth with plenty of space. The food was smaller plates so you definitely need to order a good number of dishes to be full. But I will say that the fish was really fresh and delicious. The drinks were also really good and our waiter was very friendly. Definitely worth checking out!

Lunch, happy hour or dinner. The best service, delicious food and satisfying drinks! Recommendations for drinks and dishes are based on what you enjoy and they do not disappoint. I get what I normally like and then there are specialty dishes which are too good to pass up!

Wokuni is a fantastic spot for anyone who loves
Japanese cuisine. The restaurant offers a serene and inviting atmosphere, perfect for both casual dining and special occasions. The menu is diverse, featuring everything from fresh sashimi and sushi to hearty ramen and tempura. Each dish is prepared with high-quality ingredients, ensuring authentic and delicious flavors. The sashimi platter, in particular, stands out for its freshness and beautiful presentation.
The service at Wokuni is top-notch. The staff are attentive, knowledgeable, and always ready to offer recommendations. They ensure that your dining experience is smooth and enjoyable, without making you feel rushed. The elegant and minimalist decor adds to the calming ambiance, making it a great place to relax and enjoy your meal.

While Wokuni is on the pricier side, the quality of the food and the overall dining experience make it worth the cost. It's an excellent choice for treating yourself or celebrating a special occasion. Overall, Wokuni provides a memorable dining experience with excellent food, superb service, and a relaxing atmosphere. It's definitely a must-visit for anyone who appreciates fine Japanese cuisine.

Updated Feb 2025:

Exceptional Japanese food. The sushi was amazing, the tempura items were the best and the cocktails are superb.

The service is super friendly and warm, right from the receptionist to bartenders to wait staff. They help with menu suggestions too.

The quality of fish is amongst the best, rivals top places in Japan. The presentation is fabulous and everything tastes very nice!

A must try place for any Japanese food lover.

Original Nov 2023:
Very nice sushi restaurant which does a live Tuna cutting experience every month (3rd Tuesday of each month). Make reservations and tell them you are interested in seeing the Tuna slicing.

The food is good, fish is fresh with many of the usual options. The rice seems a bit off for me, lacks enough vinegar and is super white in color. The rolls, sashimi, sushi and tempura items are super nice. The chicken karage, shrimp tempura and O Toro is exceptional. The Medai nigiri was ok.

The liquor selection is superb. Yamazakiâ€™s, Hibiki and Hakushu (including 18â€™s). A wide selection of high end Sake with a few sake flights. The lychee martini is exceptional.

They have a regular bar to sit and also a sushi bar. The service is very friendly and prompt. A must try place for some good sushi. ğŸ± ğŸ£

Got a delivery the packaging was nice and food was fresh. The bowl is kinda pricey but it's definitely good quality fish and overall very tasty.

5/31/2022 edit: I finally got to dine in here since COVID, but was kinda disappointed by their food. The chicken karagge were really good and so were the drinks. However, the bowls and sushi rolls we got were super bland and unflavorful. I was expecting sushi rice in our bowl and the roll, but it was just regular white rice. I remembered they had sushi rice last time I ordered delivery. For $40 per bowl, I would expect a little better than this. Sadly, there are many other places nearby that also have sushi bowls so I wouldn't recommend this place.

I enjoyed the sushi and kids' menu at Wokuni! The sushi was impeccably fresh, with a delightful variety that catered to diverse tastes. The kids' menu, designed with care, provided tasty options that pleased even the pickiest eaters. The overall dining experience was fantastic, blending delicious cuisine with a family-friendly atmosphere.

The food was great.
One of the servers brought us the check again after we tipped saying â€œthis is the minimum tip you should pay. I donâ€™t understand this amount at all.â€ We were almost forced to pay the tip even though it wasnâ€™t something special when paying 150+ for food. Iâ€™m not sure if I want to revisit this place although I really liked the food.

Iâ€™ve always wanna try their daily special! Itâ€™s limited so you have to come very early. The restaurant opens at 11am, and most of the time the special meal will be gone around 11:40am. Anyway, I finally got my special of the day with aâ€¦

Loved everything! The food, the service and the atmosphere. Great happy hour menu, fresh seafood and super yummy desserts! This is definitely one of my favorite Japanese restos in NYC! Highly recommended!

An unforgettable dining experience!
This place is simply amazing. Every dish was a masterpiece â€“ from the incredibly fresh fish to the perfectly crafted sushi and the heavenly desserts. The flavors were rich and balanced, and the presentation was top-notch. You can tell that great care goes into every detail, from the ingredients to the atmosphere. Easily one of the best restaurants Iâ€™ve ever visited. I canâ€™t wait to come back!
Great and fresh food, I had the bara chirashi which was filling, vibrant, and delightful. Next time will have to try the osashimi teishoku, they sold out of it the time I went bit sounds amazing.

Great good quality, nice space, and great service. Was here catching up with a friend, and we stayed chatting longer than we should have, but they were patient with us. Glad we found this place, and we'll be back!

An elevated Japanese restaurant with amazing sushi and so much more. Also every Tuesday they have a live tuna auction when they cut a huge tuna fish flown from their own farm, it was entertaining, educational and very delicious, and surprisingly affordable!
The ambiance is sexy and understated, the service was extremely nice and we will be back for sure.

Their Chirashi bowl was the highlight of the meal! Super fresh and the soup was refreshing! A must !!!

However their oyster doesnt lived up my expectations considering it has some stone clumps and kinda small

Their totoro was good but the plating looks kinda  out of theme comparing to the other dishes that were plated aesthetically!

Amazing food!
Small restaurant but fresh and very good. We are enjoy all food we had orders. Very good service and honest with tips. We did know that the price they did include tip already, but are waitress let we know.

Weâ€™ll see you again with a wonderful food ğŸ˜Š
